title: Ali Siahkoohi
text:
Simons Postdoctoral Fellow Department of Computational Applied Mathematics and Operations Research Rice University Houston, TX, USA
alisk@rice.edu CV GitHub Google Scholar

title: Ali Siahkoohi
text:
Research interests
I conduct multidisciplinary research under the guidance of Maarten V. de Hoop and Richard G. Baraniuk that focuses on developing deep learning methods to reliably solve scientific computing problems pertaining to inverse problems, uncertainty quantification, and signal processing.
Keywords: generative models, inverse problems, variational inference, amortized inference, signal processing

title: Ali Siahkoohi
text:
Education
Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA, USA Ph.D., 2022, Computational Science and Engineering
University of Tehran, Tehran, Iran M.Sc., 2016, Geophysics
Sharif University of Technology, Tehran, Iran B.Sc., 2013, Electrical Engineering

title: Ali Siahkoohi
text:
Miscellaneous
“I wish you hadn’t talked so much, it was distracting.” — Patrick Winston, How to Speak
“No one cares about the inside of your head.” — Larry McEnerney, The Craft of Writing Effectively
